name: tris(3-methoxyphenyl)phosphine
Reason: 3-methoxyphenyl groups can increase the melting point due to their effect on molecular weight and rigidity. Each methoxy group introduces a hydroxyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C. Additionally, the phosphine group introduces a rigid structure and a strong dipole moment, which can increase the melting point by approximately +20°C. The presence of three methoxyphenyl groups can contribute to an increase in molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at approximately +60°C.
